etymologies: Middle English: from Old French cormaran, from medieval Latin corvus marinus ‘sea raven’. The final -t is on the pattern of words such as peasant

definitions: a large diving bird with a long neck, long hooked bill, short legs, and mainly dark plumage. It typically breeds on coastal cliffs and is noted for its voracious appetite.

notes.text: Genus Phalacrocorax (and Nannopterum), family Phalacrocoracidae: numerous species, in particular the widespread great cormorant or European cormorant(P. carbo) and the North American double-crested cormorant (P. auritus)

shortDefinitions: large diving bird with long neck
